com.github.wuic.nut
Interface Nut

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractNut, ByteArrayNut, CompositeNut, FilePathNut, HttpNut, ImageNut, NotReachableNut, NutWrapper, PrefixedNut, WebappNut
public interface Nut
extends Serializable

The nut is the fundamental element of WUIC nut. It's represent a nut, generally corresponding to a static (CSS, Javascript, Image). It could be picked thanks to different protocol (FTP, HTTP, cloud, etc).

The name is the path relative to a location specified by a NutDao which is in charge of nut creations.

Since:
0.1.1
Version:
1.4
Author:
Guillaume DROUET

                       throws NutNotFoundException

String getName()

Returns the name of the nut. This is not a path consequently it should not contains any paths.

Returns:

getProxyUri

Gets the proxy URI.

Returns:

getVersionNumber

Future<Long> getVersionNumber()

Returns an Long indicating the version of this nut. This helps to deal with content updates.

Returns:
the nut's version

getOriginalNuts

List<Nut> getOriginalNuts()

When this nut is the result of the transformation of another one, then it is actually a processed nut. This returns a list of original nuts that have been transformed to obtain this nut. When this nut is actually an non-transformed one, say an original nut, then the returned value should be null.

Returns:
the original nuts of this nut, null if this nut is actually original
